intro: Disa physodes, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a striking member of the orchid family native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique floral structure includes a single, spurred lip that aids in pollination by specific insects. Disa physodes is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
